issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Cloud Controller should stop finding VMwareBrokers

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi All,

On the cloud-output.log of OSG strange error regarding vmware brokers are seen. The setup does not have any vmware broker installed and I find it very strange to see such errors on a 4.0.0 cloud.

None of the external tools are used to work with this cloud only euca2ools has been used.

This is in continuation of EUCA-9083

{code}

{code}

In a perfectly setup cloud with no vmware brokers I would except no binding issue with vmware broker classes. Please let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra

comments.body: This happens if you describe vmware brokers on a cloud that does not have the vmbroker installed.

Thanks [~sjones] I will try to find out who made these calls because certainly on my personal cloud no one else is going to touch except the services themselves trying to invoke such an operation which sounds really weird.
As this doesn't affect functionality, moved to post-4.0
We no longer log stack traces for unknown API actions.
